summary: Banks have about $3 trillion of their assets invested in commercial real estate loans, which is double what they had in 2012. The post-pandemic rise in remote work and declining commercial real estate prices have led to a steady increase in delinquent payments since 2022. This Q&A report examines what bank regulators are doing to monitor risks. Federal regulators said that current risks are manageable...
title: Commercial Real Estate: Trends, Risks, and Federal Monitoring Efforts
